titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Edith A.C. Houston papers (series 14) 1887-1895
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Edith A.C. Houston papers (series 14)

bioghist.p: Edith Atlee Corlies (1864-1895) was the wife of Samuel Frederic Houston and the daughter of S. Fisher Corlies, a Quaker and Philadelphia attorney. The couple had three children, Edith Corlies (1888 -1970), Margaret Corlies (1891-1970), and Henry Howard II (1895-1918). Edith died of complications following the birth of Henry, on 16 April 1895.

scopecontent.p: The Edith Atlee Corlies Houston papers contain newspaper clippings regarding her death, and one black and white photographic print of Edith with a group of children on a porch.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
